page.title: 20Richard Wakefield Charities
page.content: Tutbury charities began in 1733 with money left in Richard WakefieldÂ£s will. The charities still do a lot of the work they did 250 years ago,even now, but theyÂ£ve also added things to their list.Every person in the village 70 years old or more receives two pounds and a card on their birthday and the same at Christmas.The Charities sometimes loan money to students going to university or anyone else in need. Decisions are made in the original house that was built [nick-named the soup house for soup used to be given to people there for half a pint]. The amount of money the charities have is not known but from all the land they own,they receive an income of between two and three thousands pounds a year.
